article:
'Hermann' or 'Herrmann' is both a masculine German given name and a surname,
meaning "army man" or "warrior". Katie Martin-Doyle, The Treasury
of Baby Names, Worth Press, Cambridge 2005. ISBN 978-1903025116 Notable
people with the name include:

'Given name:' *Arminius, known as Hermann, Germanic leader opposed to Roman
conquest and victor of the Battle of the Teutoburg Forest *Hermann Abert
(1871â1927), German historian of music *Hermann Balk (died 1239), Teutonic
knight *Hermann Baumgarten (1825â1893), a German historian and political
publicist *Hermann Billung, a Margrave of Saxony *Hermann Bondi (1919â2005), Anglo-
Austrian mathematician and cosmologist *Hermann Burmeister (1807â1892), German
zoologist *Hermann Ebbinghaus (1850â1909) *Hermann Fegelein (1906â1945), Waffen-
SS General *Hermann Fressant, 14th century writer *Hermann Goldschmidt
(1802â1866), German-French astronomer who discovered the asteroid Lutetia
*Hermann GÃ¶ring, leading member of the NSDAP *Hermann Grassmann (1809â1877),
German linguist and mathematician *Hermann Gundert, a German missionary who
compiled the first Malayalam-English dictionary *Hermann Harms (1870â1942),
German botanist *Hermann von Helmholtz (1821â1894), German physicist *Hermann
Hesse, a German-born poet, novelist, and painter *Hermann Hoth (1885â1971),
German military officer *Hermann HreiÃ°arsson, footballer of Icelandic descent
*Hermann Huppen (born 1938), a Belgian comic book artist *Hermann Lang
(1909â1987), German race car driver *Hermann Maier, an Austrian skier *Hermann
Merkin (1907â1999), Jewish-American businessman *Hermann Minkowski, a Lithuanian
mathematician who devised the idea of four-dimensional spacetime *Hermann MÃ¼ller
(disambiguation), the name of several individuals *Hermann Muthesius
(1861â1927), German architect *Hermann Oberth (1894â1989), Romanian and German
physicist *Hermann Panzo (1958â1999), a French sprinter *Hermann Prey
(1929â1998), German lyric baritone *Hermann Rauschning, a German conservative
and reactionary, opponent of the Nazi party *Hermann von Salza, a Grand Master
of the Teutonic Knights *Hermann Scherchen (1891â1966), German conductor
*Hermann Schlegel (1804â1884), German ornithologist *Hermann von Siemens
(1885â1986), former head of German electronics company Siemens AG *Hermann
Wendland (1825â1903), German botanist *Hermann Weyl (1885â1955), German
mathematician *Hermann A. Widemann (1822â1899), a German businessman and Kingdom
of Hawaii cabinet member *Hermann Wilken (1522â1603), German humanist and
mathematician *Hermann Winterhalter (1808â1891), German painter *Hermann Zapf
(born 1918), German typeface designer

'Surname:' *Alexander Herrmann, German magician known as "The Great Herrmann"
*Arnulf Herrmann, German composer (born 1968) *Bernard Herrmann, American
composer *Binger Hermann (1843â1926) *Boris Herrmann, German sailor *Ed
Herrmann, American baseball player *Edward Herrmann, American actor *Erika
Hermann, birth name of Erika Steinbach *Fernand Herrmann, French silent film
actor *George H. Hermann, Hermann Park *Jacob Herrmann, German rugby union
international *Jakob Hermann, Swiss mathematician (1678â1733) *Jakob Herrmann
(born 1987), Austrian ski mountaineer and paraglider *Johann Hermann, French
zoologist *Johann Gottfried Jakob Hermann, German classical scholar and
philologist *Judith Hermann, German short story writer *Michael Herrmann, German

Herrmann, is known for his research in creative thinking and whole-brain methods
*Peter Hermann (disambiguation), several people *Robert Hermann (born 1931)
*Robert Joseph Hermann (born 1934) *Walter Herrmann, Argentinian basketball

'Fictional characters:' *Herman Hermann, a one-armed character from the American
TV series The Simpsons
